Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Teresa S
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a week long conference at the Crescent and it was fabulous. I was there for six nights. Check in was a breeze and the staff was very helpful and even more so, happy and friendly. The room was very comfortable as well as the bedding. (Love the bedding!) The grounds were kept in immaculate condition with huge trees and wonderful flowers everywhere. The dining was great too. Nice food and a comfortable lounge for gathering. This was my second stay and I will definately be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “My 2nd Stay”
Reviews.Author: steve b
Reviews.Content: I recently chaired a week long education institute at the Crescent and as with the 1st insitute we did there, my personal experience was excellent. The Crescent also received very good comments from institute staff and attendees. The rooms and grounds were in very good shape. The huge trees and vegetation on the grounds were most relaxing and the pool was clean and well attended to. My highest compliments go to the entire staff. From check in to check out, everyone was just great! They saw to our every need, were kind, courteous and came off as truely caring about their guests. We look forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is just okay ...”
Reviews.Author: Shmell
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a nice comfortable lobby, and an excellent Bell-hop/Concierge(Jason was awesome/full of great info) The free Wifi in the lobby was iffy, sometimes didn't work. I was in a room on the 5th floor, decent view of pool area. The hotel room could use some updating(bathroom tiles / faucets etc) Excellent a/c in the room. Overall I rate this hotel a 3/5.

Reviews.Title: “Took a tour of the property and had lunch”
Reviews.Author: reallyreen
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel to preview staying here for an upcoming event. We were treated to lunch in the hotel restaurant and toured the facilities. Lunch was excellent! We saw several rooms including the presidential suite, which was very impressive. I was very impressed with the location, accommodations, staff, and rooms. For being located near a busy road, it had very tranquil grounds. I'm looking forward to our event and staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Very very nice”
Reviews.Author: Michael M
Reviews.Content: From the moment I walked in I received nothing but help from every employe there, the front desk girl help get us checked in and made sure me and my wife didn't need anything. Can't remember her name but she did wear glasses( very helpful) then we asked if we could get a shuttle to a nice restaurant and we were taken by a young gentlemen that recommended US very good place for steaks and were amazed,( guy was mexican and was the shuttle driver he told us that he parents made him learn English and he was awesome everything very well handled and staff were amazing. See you next year at the next paintball event.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous customer service!!! Jesus #1”
Reviews.Author: bmallonee
Reviews.Content: Jesus was the greatest bell hop, driver and conciere ever. I traveled with a group of 6 other people and Jesus always had time to help us out. Because of Jesus, I would be glad to stay at the Sheraton in Phoenix anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Crescent, Phoenix, Arizona”
Reviews.Author: Jan L
Reviews.Content: Customer Service was excellent, rooms were spacious and very clean. Had a special program that allowed you the opportunity to turn down room service everyday. Each day you received a $5 voucher that could be used in the hotel or for reward points. Loved not waiting on housekeeping every day to get done. Still gave refillls on towels, coffee, water, and toiletries. Free shuttle service within a 5 mile radius. Outdoor dining and pool and exercise room. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not for families with toddlers”
Reviews.Author: KazfromSydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights. This place is fine if you only plan to stay for a few nights, but not a whole week, especially with an 18 month old. We chose the hotel due to its proximity to a mall, but the locals advised us to not to walk beyond the hotel complex as it wasn't a safe neighborhood. The hotel has a pool, which would be okay for families with older kids, but not for toddlers as the lowest depth was 4ft. The room we were given was on the fifth floor overlooking the freeway, and so was very noisy. We heard sirens and trucks honking throughout the day and night. The bathroom had apricot tiles with matching grout... at least we hoped it was the grout and not pink mould! We tried various items from the bistro's dinner and breakfast menus. The dinner menu was limited and was average, but the breakfast was always good. The bed was comfortable and the room spacious. Housekeeping and bistro staff were all friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Crescent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Loralee E
Reviews.Content: I want to express how impressed I was with Mr. Josh Hinks and the staff of the Sheraton Crescent Hotel in Phoenix, Arizona. They were amazingly accomodating and helpful, and the hotel itself was wonderfully maintained. My experience there was great. Because of how positive Mr. Hinks and his staff made my stay, I can promise that when I visit Phoenix again, I will be staying at the Sheraton Crescent.

Reviews.Title: “Service wihtout even asking”
Reviews.Author: TravelingChicagoDave
Reviews.Content: IWonderful caring folks working at the hotel. The hotel was very clean and the free parking in the covered garrage was a pleasant surprise. It seems that each time I had a question for the staff - not only did they answer it, but followed up with helpfull information without prodding. This team knows how to go the extra mile. The bartender, Steve treats each patron with duly attentiveness making you feel both comfortable and special. He takes pride in his knowledge of the beers he has on tap and is happy to share his expertise for mixed drinks as well.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation Time”
Reviews.Author: Andrew G
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 night's to attend some spring training baseball. The hotel and staff were great. We had a room in the club section which provided some nice extra's. The hotel has free parking and is in a central location. I just might be back next spring.

Reviews.Title: “Really great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Kliggins0376
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very attentive staff. The hotel room was really clean, better than expected.The only thing I had a problem with was a rude guy who came out to the pool to tell the kids he will close the pool down if they continue to act out. For god sake they are kids. I just wished he would've spoke to an adult about it or found out whos children we out there without parents. Other than that it was a great stay and the front desk was awesome. We had a nice view. The breakfast was great and the staff there kept everything full and clean throughtout breakfast.We had a great time there and will visit again next year. Thank you Sheraton Crescent. Remeber to keep your employees happy!

Reviews.Title: “A little retro, but really nice”
Reviews.Author: US40
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Very friendly staff. The hotel incl the rooms are a little dated and the hotel has a somewhat "retro" feel to it. But it still is in good shape and doesn't miss any services. Seems convenient and close to many restaurants and shopping. Easy drive from/to the airport. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Jessica”
Reviews.Author: chris f
Reviews.Content: Jessica who took our breakfast order had the nicest sweetest friendliest voice you can imagine. it was wonderful to hear a pleasant voice so early in the morning. not to mention to room service was prompt!

Reviews.Title: “Arizona Native Business Owner”
Reviews.Author: Jamie S
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to work with the staff at the Sheraton Crescent recently. Our enterprise business rented out the Crescent Ballroom for an event that we were holding. The staff was flawless from the initial set-up to the final teardown. Everything ran seamlessly smooth. I was contacted in advance about my expectations for the set-up and they kept me informed throughout the entire process. When I arrived the day of the event, I was welcomed warmly and was extremely pleased that they exceeded my expectations. Because everything was set-up perfectly, I was able to focus on greeting my guests and not stressing about other things. I was proud to share this event location with my collegues and was completely satisied. It is worth me mentioning, The PSAV Presentation Services (audio/visual company) went above and beyond to accommodate my needs and helped make my event a success! EXCELLENT CONFERENCE SERVICES!

Reviews.Title: “Barely okay.”
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff is polite and helpful. My club level room looks dated but clean. There is no refrigerator or safe in the room. Maintenance very quickly repairs the broken lamp. The crescent shape of the hotel is perfect for echoing the sounds all night long from the freeway located across the street. Make sure you do not select a room facing the freeway. The hotel restaurant burns my son's hamburger. This is how I discover that the restaurant manager is also my waiter. If you have patience, low expectations, and want to save a little money, this may be the right hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “sheraton crescent phoenix”
Reviews.Author: mgdog
Reviews.Content: We returned to Phoenix because of this hotel. We wanted to get away from the dreary weather at home and we discovered this hotel last year. It is almost like a mini-resort. There is a beautiful courtyard, nice pool/hot tub, fun waterslide, fitness center with raquetball, basketball, tennis, so much! They loan out everything you'll need. They are absolutely the MOST welcoming staff! It is a very NICE hotel and it really makes us feel at home. Many families staying here. This is absolutely my favorite hotel. We stayed here for 5 days. We pay the extra $$ to stay on the 'club' level and our room was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: luvDogs1212
Reviews.Content: Great location for the Glendale area! The pool is amazing. Very good & reasonable breakfast--portions large enough to split. Hotel staff very friendly & accomodating. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Odd mix of run down and spiffy”
Reviews.Author: GLennox
Reviews.Content: Okay, this property is confusing. The public spaces are recently renovated and very nice. The guest rooms are shockingly old and in need of refurbishment...the first hint of which are the colonial style brass door knockers on each guest room...followed by cheap looking, very worn bathrooms, and mattresses which are the worst I can remember ANYWHERE. We had a double bed, and the mattress was so tired, that we couldn't help rolling into each other because the center of the mattress was sagged so badly. Some really great outdoor facilities--tennis, beach volleyball, water slide...but that doesn't make up for lousy rooms. Not coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: danyulk
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night for a music event. Check-in was a breeze. Staff was very nice. Room was nice as well. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A Resort Hotel without the Resort”
Reviews.Author: gbtrotter
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Crescent is a really unique hotel. Surrounded by freeway restaurants and businesses, it's really an oasis. The limited grounds are quite beautiful as is the pool/spa areas. The tennis courts are well-maintained and there is even a lovely little play area for children. Most amazing is the most fabulous gym that is included in the cost of the room - probably the most well-equipped complimentary facility I have ever seen at a full-service hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Sheraton for families/couples on vacation”
Reviews.Author: Debi S
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty and classy hotel from outside to lobby areas. Conference center looked very nice though I did not attend a conference there. Staff friendly and helpful. Stayed in club room on 7th floor for 3 nights on business. Room lighting was horrible, no lamp by desk (I have great eyesight and am in early 40's). Older hotel so lack of plugs in room. Plug by bed behind bed. Plug by desk underneath it & had to get on floor to plug in computer. Wired or wireless Internet access complimentary in club rooms otherwise $9.95 in room. They do have a Microsoft funded center off lobby with several computers and 2 with printer access. I had to login there so I think you have to pay for Internet there too unless in club room. Decent Internet speed in room but in lobby slower at their computers. The Club floor club was small and evening snacks ok. No free drinks except soda/water. Club not well stocked with water or soda throughout 4 days there. AM breakfast was continental with Starbucks coffee, hard boiled eggs, cereals, oatmeal, pastries, and frut. Bed very comfortable with nice sheets. Pillows way too soft for me. Bathroom clean and fairly well maintained. Towels mostly fluffy. Ate at restaurant in hotel one evening. Not enough servers or they weren't efficient even though not terribly busy. Menu okay. Outdoor eating area nice but again slow service. Room faced pool with slide. Not too noisy unless patio door open. Patios are too narrow for a chair. In general, pool areas looked very nice though didn't use. Noise levels in room were very good-not disturbed in morning or evening but I do carry and use a noise machine. In some hotels, I hear noise beyond the noise machine and then that is bad but not here. I like the eco-savings where if you don't get your room serviced, for each night you can get a $5 voucher for food somewhere or 500 Starwood points each night. Hotel is right off I-17 but would need car as not much in walking distance. It is close to business area. Parking is free in parking garage to side of hotel. Parking garage does not have an elevator into the hotel so need to walk around the side of the building to the front. I felt reasonably safe at night. If you want to see something interesting, head left out of the hotel and about a mile down on right in the middle of a residential section see cows, llamas, goats, and more in front of a house. Animals seem well kept and did have to park on side road and walk to go take pictures up close. Good hotel for families and couples on vacation and business people not wanting to get much work done in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Average overall, but details are neglected - not recommended”
Reviews.Author: Jim G
Reviews.Content: The hotel seems understaffed - those present seem overworked and running from task to task. The hotel was fully booked for at least half of our five-day stay, but there was hardly anyone around. Today I was walking down the hall and saw a significant number of rooms still being serviced by housekeeping after 4pm. We stayed on the club level, and the club was also understaffed. There was a nice breakfast available in the lounge, but the only attendent was frantically attempting to keep everything stocked. Also, snacks and drinks were supposed to be available all day in the lounge, but the coffee and tea were taken away after breakfast and were not available even upon request later in the day, the drink refrigerator (with a damaged door seal preventing its contents from staying cool) was often completely empty), although at other times it was stocked with a small selection of bottled water and sodas. The internet cafe in the lobby lounge had two of five computers out of service and the printer appears to have been out of service for some time. The bathrooms, while dated, were adequate, although there were cracks in the caulk around the faucets and tiles - I'm afraid to imagine how much mold may be growing in the walls. The view outside is great, with views of the mountains all around. You can see the swimming pool and hottub and several tennis courts that are available for guest use. One side of the hotel, however, is bordered by the interstate highway, and the view in another direction is filled with a several acre dirt lot. This hotel is not owned by Sheraton or Starwoods. It is owned by the publicly-traded FelCor hotel investment trust and licenses the Sheraton name. This probably explains why the hotel has not profited from Sheraton's recent '6 billon dollar' chain-wide renovation campaign. I don't know how old the building is, but it appears the last major renovation was probably in the mid-1980s. I haven't stayed at the downtown Phoenix Sheraton, but I'll try them before ever staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Given the worst room in the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Travelingdodger
Reviews.Content: I am a SPG member and upon check in I was shocked to have been given the worst room in this hotel. It was at the end of the hall in a dark corner by the emergency exit door. The room was above a very busy intersection and it was so noisy I was sure I would never be able to sleep. When I called the front desk H said she would speak to her manager for me and call me right back. She never did. After 45 minutes I called back and she said "sorry we are booked.". I paid in advance through their website and felt like I was treated very poorly. I finally went downstairs and we were moved to a quieter room but I really felt this shouldn't have been so hard. Staying here another night, I hope it improves.

Reviews.Title: “Charging for internet is a huge black mark for me!”
Reviews.Author: SharonToji
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Crescent is imposing looking, although the public spaces don't seem very intimate. The room was very nice, spacious and well and attractively furnished, although the bed was a bit softer than we like. However, I was really put off by the $10.00 a day internet charge. Normally, when a hotel (and this costs somewhat more than say, Holiday Inn), doesn't have free internet in the room, they at least provide it in the lobby. But no, when I signed on in the lobby, they wanted my room number so they could charge $10.00. Even the conference where I was a speaker didn't allow me to sign on. There was nothing about this hotel that was so wonderful, for the price, that made seem worthwhile to me to add another $10.00 a day for internet access -- something I think every hotel should now provide within its room charge, or at least have available in the public spaces. Another negative for me was the book provided in the room with all the hotel amenities, safety instructions, and room service menus. It was virtually unreadable -- over-designed in a script font, with pastel type on a pastel background. There was no need for it to be unattractive, but it certainly needs to be something that those who don't have typical "young adult" eyesight can still read! Now for the positives. The desk people were very nice. I was late because of a flat tire, and didn't have time to check in before my presentation. They understood immediately, took our bags to store, and took my seminar materials to the conference room without any long explanations. The hotel was certainly clean and well kept, and as I said, the room was nicely decorated and pleasant. We had a wonderful balcony, and if we had been there on a pleasure trip for several days, I can see that it would have been a pleasure to use it, and to enjoy some of their outdoor dining spaces.

Reviews.Title: “Overall very nice.”
Reviews.Author: Kzw2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for its proximity to the freeway and soccer fields for our soccer tournament. It was overall a very nice hotel.  Free covered parking is nice. The family loved the giant fast waterside. I loved the cloud-like pillows and comfortable beds.  The in-room water bottles were only $1.00.   The negatives for us were wireless charges of 9.95 per device per day. With two laptops and a Kindle those charges were frustrating. The balcony was too narrow to sit out on.  We'd stayed here before and had a bigger balcony. Make sure you ask for a corner room with a larger balcony if this feature is important to you. The grout in the bathroom was quite stained and in need of updating. The sheets were very stiff-rough.  The pool was very cold which is probably refreshing in July but in March, not so much. We would stay here again despite these negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Angie D
Reviews.Content: Our family ,which includes 3 children, stayed at the Crescent at the beginning of our week long trip to The Grand Canyon, and at the end of our trip. We flew in and out of Sky Harbor Airport in Phoenix, so this location made sense. It's proximity to the highway was very convenient as well. I saw the function of this hotel primarily to be a place to lay our heads during our vacation, but it turned out to be much more. My family was pleasantly surprised by the amenities this hotel offered. The kids were well entertained by the pools and the big slide. My daughter took great delight in the little playground and was amazed by the fragrant orange trees that surrounded the property. My 2 boys spent energy release time at the basketball court, fitness room and squash/racquetball courts. The hotel rooms are a little outdated but very clean and comfortable. Our room faced the pool area overlooking the slide, which tickled the kids. It also faced the mountains away from the traffic side which made my husband and me happy. The most pleasant surprise was the hotel restaurant, Indigo. My family voted the breakfast we had here the best of our entire vacation. The lunch was also very good. I would like to recognize our waiter, Garrett, who's service was exceptional during both visits. The hotel lobby, lounge, restaurant, computer corrals and meeting areas all appeared recently updated and more modern. The front desk employees were always helpful, friendly and professional. We would stay at this hotel again if our future travels bring us back to the Phoenix area.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: ViennaLover
Reviews.Content: I was in Phoenix for business and decided to stay at this property. This hotel is very convenient for all types of travellers. The bathrooms are a bit dated, but the rest of the room is well appointed with the usual modern fare: flat screen TV, WiFi, alarm, desk, table, etc. What always gets me in most hotels is a lack of electrical outlets by the bed. I called reception and a surge protector was brought up for me right away. Wonderful service. Another characteristic that I liked was the option not to have your room made up everyday. If you do not wish for formal housekeeping, then you have an option of getting 500 Starwood points or $5 dollars in food credit for the hotel. As I am not a slob, and not such a stickler if my room is not made up, I opted for the Starwood points. The staff is friendly and welcoming. I would be happy to stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Business Meeting - 2.10.12 - B. Holt”
Reviews.Author: nappytip6
Reviews.Content: It was the best experience from start to finish. My event planner Jocelin Messenburg - excellent, my Banquet Captain - Jonathan - excellent, and my AV Guru - Bob - excellent. The food was good, and the meeting room fit our business needs. I would recommend this hotel for your next meeting in the Phoenix metro area. Event the front desk was accommodating when we used the house phone requesting to have the air turned down. Thank you for providing such a great atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Byron H
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Crescent Hotel experience was an overall relaxing and enjoyable stay for myself and coworkers. This would be the second time we stayed and used the Sheraton Crescent Hotel amenities. Our hotel accomodations were set up professionaly by Cassandra Henderson and SunnyDeRosia. Not only did they provide convenient accomodations, but made everything simple and easy. We were welcomed by all staff members and our staff appreciated and enjoyed that greatly. Rooms were nicely maintained and cleaned daily. Other amenities made our stay even more exciting. You want hospitality on your trip? I would recommend making Sheraton Crescent for your next trip or event.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service is #1”
Reviews.Author: jill h
Reviews.Content: I love the Sheraton Crescent!! I work for a local school district and we always try to host our events at this fabulous hotel! It's clean, convenient, welcoming and their customer service is absolutely incredible!!! I have worked with Frank Kuhns and Jocelin Meesenburg and felt like every need for our event was more than met! I also like the fact that the Sheraton Crescent supports the community - I love their 3rd Thursday events that support Ear Candy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: MArrington
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful, relaxing and accommodating hotel. My husband and I stayed on the Club Level, which provided additional amenities. The room and the bathroom were large and comfortable. There is a lounge available to club level guests, which has soft drinks and water, continental breakfast, evening appetizers, computer, printer and television at no extra charge! We also had free wi-fi in our room, which was an absolute must for us since we both had course work to complete. We had a beautiful view of the courtyard and a very small balcony, which allowed us to step outside and enjoy the fresh air and the view. I wish we could have taken a dip in the pool, but it was not open since it's winter. The only complaint I have is that there aren't enough outlets in the room. Other than that, we enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay. Needs a facelift.”
Reviews.Author: lmbrjckmn
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. The room was clean but could use a facelift. Very dated. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Renea J
Reviews.Content: I had the most wonderful experience while visiting this property! From the time I walked through the door until the time I left the staff made me feel like a queen. Especially Jocelin Meesenburg, Director of Catering. She was a true gem! Not only was the staff amazing but the property is a hidden treasure full of plush trees and gardens. I would highly recommend the property for travel or and event!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be renovated”
Reviews.Author: SpaJumper
Reviews.Content: Pros: Close to freeway, comfy bed, good customer service, Starbucks cafe in lobby, free parking, flat screen TV. Cons: Small and outdated bathroom. Peeling paint and wallpaper, dirty tile, bathtub drainage issure. Yes, the deal was good for the cash & points but I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty, clean, and fun!”
Reviews.Author: Mia C
Reviews.Content: It is right across the street from Castles and Coasters, which is a fun mini amusement park with miniature golf. In the hotel there is a nice bar, and computers for guests. We didn't get to eat at the hotel, but they have a nice menu. The hotel room we had was spacious and nice, and even had a (very) small balcony if you like to step outside. And I liked the pink tiles in the shower - I think the pink tiles are very classic, and it's very classy that they don't replace things that don't need to be. They had a recycling bin in the room, and they have a program where you can earn future credits if you decline room service. There is a nice hot tub, pool, and a fast and fun water slide. They have tennis courts and a sand volleyball pit. (There may be something we missed!) The grounds are very tropical and pretty. Lots of big trees. We did book through a third party and didn't feel any resentment. There is a fabulous authentic Italian store and deli, Romanelli's, about two miles west on the same street. Lots of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Pet friendly and good service”
Reviews.Author: Richard A
Reviews.Content: Thanks for the pet friendly Hotel and a special thanks to Chelsea Poling at the Indigo Restaurant For the wonderful service!

Reviews.Title: “Dont book through a third party”
Reviews.Author: AzFr8train
Reviews.Content: Just had to say that if you book through a third party I.E hotwire or hotels.com or any other they will treat you like you do not belong there. Im even a gold memeber with sheraton and have always stayed on the club level no matter who I book through but the night manager Alan wanted to charge me even more. He then put me and my family in a handicap room , after we asked why that was he Lied and said it was what we had requested through hotwire. After calling Hotwire as Im an Express memeber with them they called the hotel and asked to please not treat hotwire customers like that as NO we did not request a handicap room. And yes they had other rooms available as we had looked at one thinking about the extra charge on the club level. So if you see this hotel on a third party site DO NOT book . It is not our fault the corporation uses the third party sites and then get treated bad by the local managment.

Reviews.Title: “I'm a guest too?!”
Reviews.Author: aztrtl
Reviews.Content: If you book your room through any 3rd party, be prepared to be treated less than stellar at this location. I've stayed at Sheraton in the past through 3rd party and treated great, but after staying at this location on Monday evening, I will never stay here again. The beds are only double beds and very hard. Other Sheraton's have much better beds but we were told by the night front desk manager (Allen I believe) that these were Sheraton beds. Because we booked through 3rd party, they put us on 2nd floor in a handicap accessible room where no one could really take a shower unless you wanted to hold the shower nozzle your entire shower. They said they were booked but they had rooms that were available to show the potential bridal parties they were catering to that night trying to get people to book weddings. WiFi is not free and the pool is just so so. It was a decent price but I will never book this location again after how we were treated for booking through a 3rd party.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great location for those staying north of downtown”
Reviews.Author: kyle34
Reviews.Content: If you need affordable lodging on the north side of town, you are unlikely to do better than than the Sheraton Crescent. Situated along I-17, it was a surprisingly full service property offering reasonable rates. SPG members will appreciate the club lounge and reasonably fast WiFi. Their gym is much larger and better equipped than most Sheratons, and open 24 hours. The pool area is quite large for a business hotel, with a swimming pool, hot tub and large water slide for the kids. My niece and nephews were very enthusiastic about the slide, so I'd have to say the hotel is very kid-friendly. The only downside is that it is locked and requires hunting down a staff member to let you in to the water slide pool. High praise for the friendly front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very Grateful”
Reviews.Author: DonkArizona
Reviews.Content: Most people write reviews to alert other travelers of their experiences at hotels. My experience with the Sheraton was a typical stay, everything met my expectations. Little did I know that one month later my typical stay with this particular hotel would exceed my expectations. On November 20th my family was at the Sheraton for my niece's wedding, it wasn't until almost one month later I discovered that I had misplaced a 7 diamond journey necklace. I began thinking where I had worn it last, it was the week-end of the wedding at the hotel. I figured the worst, if it had been found I'm sure someone would have pawned it by now. A co-worker of mine talked me into calling the hotel to see if they had recovered it. A short time later (that same evening) I received a call from the hotel's security asking me if I could identify the necklace. I described it the best I could, hoping they had good news. Turns out someone in housekeeping had found it in the corridor near the room where I had stayed. I feel the honesty of the staff of this hotel is incredible and I cannot thank them enough for doing what most people would not. Let's face it, not all hotels are created equal. There are still people out there that know how to be honest. Thank you to all the staff involved in recovering a very special piece of jewelry to me.

Reviews.Title: “Over the top customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Dennis V
Reviews.Content: Service beyond the beyond. What a fantastic job they do in every respect. They will literally give you the shirt off their back (this is true---they did). When I packed one shirt too little, they gave me their's and made me look better than I could make myself look. Thank you Ms. Walton!

Reviews.Title: “Scout School”
Reviews.Author: bear1455
Reviews.Content: My 2 week stay at your hotel was very comfortable. My room was always clean and properly updated every day. The food was always good and service was friendly and accomodating. Thank you for a relaxing 2 weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value!”
Reviews.Author: HarleyML
Reviews.Content: For many years, I've stayed here several weeks every fall. As someone who stays in hotels over 200 nights a year, I can say that the Crescent ranks right at the top for service, value and accommodations. Large pool area, good food and drink in both the bar and restaurant, friendly front desk service, etc... And the most comfortable beds anywhere!!! I recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great place at a fair price.

Reviews.Title: “Wow this hotel is incredible, staff were very friendly too!”
Reviews.Author: lachaplin
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just amazing. Had no idea we were in for what we got - a 5 star with amazingly clean and comfy rooms with beautiful decor and very friendly staff. All I can say is stay here, the price was so cheap and what you get in return was perfect, the beds were the best we stayed in accross the whole of America and the staff were brilliant. Parking was easy and the pool looked nice although we didn't use it.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service!”
Reviews.Author: ShevonShannon
Reviews.Content: I had my entire family stay at this hotel on the weekend of my brother's wedding, November 19th, 2011. During our stay, the staff at this hotel made the entire weekend perfect. I would like to give special thanks to Mike at the front desk for repeatedly going above and beyond for my family and I. Megan from the front desk, and the front office supervisor David, were also amazing in helping me get things planned out. The front desk staff called me by name every time, and were very helpful. The bartender Steve was great at his job, and was very friendly. Rooms were immaculate and the beds were so comfortable. Staying at this hotel was a wonderful decision, and I would reccommend it to any one!

Reviews.Title: “Rough start but overall pretty good”
Reviews.Author: KelownaMustang
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over the November 11th weekend as part of a package deal for the Nascar event. Upon arrival my taxi cab driver was having problems putting through my c/c and the valet service were a little rude because of the delay and I seemed to be the one they were giving the gears to. Sorry for not driving up in a Rolls. Checking in was smooth and quick, the staff were courteous and helpful throughout my stay. My room was fine, nothing special but very clean and no complaints. We had breakfast in the dining room twice and breakfasts were okay, some in our group weren't too excited about the steak dinners one evening. The lounge was nice but a bit on the expensive side at least for me. If you aren't too concerned about where your having a drink in a fancy setting, go to O'Connor's Pub across the street. Very inexpensive beers and cocktails. Never had a chance to use the pool, probably if not for the rude valet I would have rated a little higher.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Excellence”
Reviews.Author: SpecialKNJ
Reviews.Content: I used to stay at this hotel a number of years ago when I used to travel to PHX for business. I decided to stay a few days at the property and couldn't of been happier with the service. From the minute I walked into the hotel and checked in, I was happy to see a level of customer service that a lot of hotels lack..a person with a personality checking me in. They even asked upfront if I needed late check-out.They treat SPG Platnium folks good here so I was pleased with a room upgrade and access to the club lounge.Yes, the rooms are a little dated but they are clean and for SPG Platnium, you get bottled water, a robe, free internet, etc. The club level is available all day if you need to grab a soda or something. The Indigo restaurant has a great lunch menu and the service was fantastic. Even the maid was friendly and asked me how my day was. These little touches go a long way and I think the hotel should be recognized for that. When I left today, I was impressed that the front desk remembered me and I was happy with my stay. Great rates, great service!

Reviews.Title: “A Modest SPG”
Reviews.Author: gvbala
Reviews.Content: This is a decent property with value for money. Nicely located on freeway and just across the Mall. However, I found the laundry service was poor. I had to send the cloths back couple of times to get rid of the stains. Choice of food in the restaurent is very limited. As a vegitarian from India, I had tough time selecting food from the menu. Though I am not choosy for food, there was literally no choice except going for a pizza every time in my 15 days stay.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOSLY FIFTY!!”
Reviews.Author: Nina W
Reviews.Content: I recently celebrated my 50th birthday. I decided to do something for myself and by myself. I traveled alone to Arizona and stayed at the Sheraton Crescent. The beautifully decorated and clean lobby caught my attention as soon as I walked in the door. As soon as I approached the front desk to check in, the hospitality and kindness I receieved was confirmation to me that I had made the right choice. All of my request were met with warm smiles. I was there for 7 days. The personnel and I were on first name basis. They made some great recommendations to me and made sure everything came together. Although I took a trip by myself, because of them, I was not alone. Thanks to them, my birthday was an event I will never forget!!!

Reviews.Title: “Only an average SPG hotel”
Reviews.Author: NigelMA
Reviews.Content: I stay in a lot of SPG hotels, some are great, some awful and some, like this one, a mix of both. If you are an SPG platinum member be sure to ask if they have suite upgrade (even though you are supposed to be offered the best available room this isn't always what happens). The suite I was in had a nice balcony area to sit out and enjoy the warm evenings, but the bed head on my bed was falling off (generally this hotel seemed to lack attention to high standards of care). The SPG lounge is open to anyone paying for an SPG level room and when we went in a bunch of kids had completely trashed it ... Note the hotel doesn't provide anyone in attendance in the lounge - dirty plates pile up quickly and breakfast items run out so one of the worst lounge experiences I've had (this lounge also charges for beer and wine where many others do not). There is a good pool area outside for families and while I didn't get to try it I understand they have extensive fitness facilities including squash and tennis.

Reviews.Title: “Third Thursday event supporting Ear Candy”
Reviews.Author: GraceAshley
Reviews.Content: The evening was the perfect opportunity to support EAR CANDY, a local charity that provides youth access to music education. It was a fun girls night out complete with excellent entertainment, food and drinks in a beautiful garden setting. The silent auction was beautifully humble and detailed to include only quality items that we would not find elsewhere (so refreshing!!). We had a lovely time and look forward to returning to the Crescent Hotel to support Ear Candy in the future. Kudos to the fine folks at the Crescent for supporting our local charities in such a grand way!

Reviews.Title: “Feels Like Home”
Reviews.Author: david e
Reviews.Content: i have been staying at the Sheraton Crescent for years and it feels like my home away from home. the staff is great and on a recent trip (back to back weeks without going home), I arrived on a friday afternoon with a suitcase of used laundry and headed into the office to work overnight. When I got back to the hotel Saturday afternoon it was after 12 and I was without clean clothes. Worse, I needed to head back into the the office by 4;30. The front desk manager quickly arranged to pickup my laundry and when I awoke at 4:00 I was pleasantly surprised that my clothes had been returned, laundered, folded and fresh. Nice job sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Best Phoenix Hotel”
Reviews.Author: michelle b
Reviews.Content: I travel several times a month and stay at this hotel brand. At the Sheraton Crescent, I'm most impressed with the staff; excellent service really is their pleasure. I'm home when I'm at the Sheraton Crescent. The service is so superior at this hotel, I had an opportunity to treat my aunts, nieces and, cousins to a weekend stay during the Susan G. Komen Breast Cancer Race 4 the Cure this month. 7 rooms and 15 women; the staff made them feel like rock stars. KUDOS to the staff of the Sheraton Crescent in Phoenix, AZ.

Reviews.Title: “3rd Thursday Live benefiting Ear Candy Charity”
Reviews.Author: Luke K
Reviews.Content: Although I haven't had the pleasure of staying overnight at this property I have been to two seperate 3rd Thursday events. The property is elegant, relaxing, pleasing to the eyes and ears, and the staff is very accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome 3rd Thursday Event!”
Reviews.Author: aimzblingz
Reviews.Content: I attended the 3rd Thursday last night at the Sheraton Crescent. It was their annual Charity Event for Ear Candy. Listening to awesome music under the stars in the hotel's beautiful garden... it doesn't get much better than that!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: ttori
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean, the pool very nice and relaxing. Everything was hassle free, and made for a great stay

Reviews.Title: “"Going the Extra Mile"”
Reviews.Author: Nativewellness
Reviews.Content: Was attending a meeting at this hotel and needed a last minute shirt pressing for a presentation. However, I had already checked out. Jurek Rakoczynski, a security officer with the hotel saw me fretting about it in the convention area and asked if he could help. After explaining my situation, he took my shirt and went to iron it himself! I was astounded and grateful. As a loyal customer of Sheraton Hotels for over 25 years, this was one of the nicest gestures of customer service and going the extra mile I have ever experienced. Billy Rogers

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Crescent hotel in Phoenix, AZ”
Reviews.Author: April N
Reviews.Content: Honesty and integrity above and beyond will keep us going back year after year! We host an Annual Fall Ball and Alumni Gala for our dancing school, Spisak Dance Academy. We've been in business for 52 years and still teaching the art of dance to all who come through our door! It's a pretty big event for us and we have fund raising for scholarships for dance families in need. I left our scholarship raffle money in my guest room, and didn't realize it until the next day. I just figured it was lost forever and didn't bother to call the hotel on Sunday. Was a horrible day for me; I was too embarrassed to even mention it to anyone. On Monday I had to call to talk about planning another event for a large dance organization here in Arizona. I just happened to mention what happened and asked if anything had been turned in, throughly expecting the worse. No one leaves cash in a room and expects it to be found and returned! Well, within the hour, Nicole Hobbs gave me the wonderful news! The envelope with the scholarship money was not only found, but turned in to security and they had it for me at the hotel! They also found my cell phone charger--didn't realize that was left, either! Many kudos to Nicole and the housekeeping staff, Dunlap the security officer, and everyone who works at the property. Very honest employees deserve a big heart-felt THANK YOU from me.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Area To Stay To See Phoenix and areas north”
Reviews.Author: alexandermanley
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right off Hwy. 17 about 10 miles north of downtown Phoenix. The hotel has a great pool area, fitness center, and the rooms are comfortable. Sedona is less than two hours north on Hwy. 17 and the Grand Canyon just two hours farther north.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property for meetings”
Reviews.Author: Michelle H
Reviews.Content: The experience our company had with the Sheraton Crescent in Phoenix was amazing, to say the least. My company held a two and a half day seminar at this property for approximately 250 attendees. This seminar was the first of this size that I’ve coordinated solely on my own. I’m thrilled to report that I did not feel “alone” on my journey. From the time I met their Sales Manager to tour the facility 8 months prior to the seminar through the time I finished paying invoices post meeting, the hotel staff was more than I could have asked for. Our seminar truly could not have been as successful as it was without the partnership from the staff at the Sheraton Crescent. As one would expect and hope for, the property is maintained well. We did not run into any cleanliness issues throughout the hotel, in the meeting space, or in the rooms. This is a given so I won’t go too into detail here. It is most important for me to speak to the professionalism of the staff. From the associates running the meeting to the actual attendees, I continually heard comments about how nice the staff was. For me, this is an understatement. I could not believe the level of kindness, sense of urgency, and patience the hotel staff has. My experience with the entire hotel staff – from the General Manager all the way to the room service staff – was wonderful! Each person we encountered during the meeting showed a much higher level of customer service than I’ve seen at other properties. Our meeting was, at times, a bit chaotic with rotating breakout sessions and 250 attendees moving throughout the meeting space. The Sheraton Crescent staff partnered with us to make sure the transitions were smooth and timely. The attendees never felt the chaos, which is the best we can ask for! The meeting space worked well for our seminar. The rooms are spread out enough to avoid too much bottle necking during transitions but close enough together to make the transitions smooth and keep our breakout sessions on time. As a meeting coordinator having a walkie-talkie to reach any department I needed was INVALUABLE! If I wasn’t able to reach the exact person I needed because they were tied up I was able to find someone else immediately. I would personally like to recognize the banquet managers, Jonathan and Josh, and their staff for being quick to respond to changes as they came up. Our group had much more specialty meal restrictions than a group this size generally does. Many of the restrictions we didn’t learn about until after the first meal was served. Jonathan and Josh were right on top of the changes, accommodated the on the spot requests, and came up with alternative meal plans for the remaining meals. All without missing a beat along the way. After meeting hours our attendees enjoyed the pool slide, jacuzzi, restaurant, and bar. The hotel staff made sure our attendees had everything they needed at all times. Finally, in a post seminar survey to our attendees we asked two questions specific to the meals and accommodations at this property. Our attendees rated the Sheraton Crescent a 4.55 out of 5. They were a very pleased group! I left this seminar with a new appreciation for what a large scale meeting can and should be. I’ve recommended this hotel to several other departments in my company. I will definitely use the Sheraton Crescent for future meetings (and stay-cations)!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable yet upscale business hotel with excellent servive.”
Reviews.Author: drakesadler
Reviews.Content: Well located in center of town. Palacial interior. Very well run. Staff helpful. Food and menu were good. Will return

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are adequate. Convenient location. Reasonable rates.”
Reviews.Author: Nightingale7210
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed here twice. The hotel is clean, rooms are large and comfortable. Food at the restaurant is okay. Convenient place if you are doing things in the Phoenix area and the rates are decent.

Reviews.Title: “They gave me the shirt off their back! (Ok - their jacket!)”
Reviews.Author: Jamie C
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a 2-day planning retreat with my team at the Sheraton. Not only was the facility beautiful, parking easy, every employee prompt and courteous - but when I was freezing in the conference room (even after they adjusted the air conditioner) - the general manager gave me her personal jacket to warm up! Now that's service! She even let me keep it over night. The food was top rate too. I believe the environment and service really added to the productivity and tone of our meeting. We'll be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Customer service makes this hotel 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: oldrxstudent
Reviews.Content: The hotel was obviously constructed in the 70s, but it is impeccably maintained. We were disappointed that the water slide was broken during our stay, but how can we complain when the hotel staff called before our arrival to inform us of this? The pool and huge jacuzzi were operational, and we enjoyed them thoroughly. We were given a $5 voucher toward food or beverage at the hotel for not having maid service on the first night of our stay (our choice, not a problem on the part of the hotel!). I never have the maids come in anyway, so this was a great deal. The only minor complaint would be the charge for internet, which we passed up anyway. What makes this hotel so outstanding is the customer service. Every single employee went out of his or her way to make our family welcome. From the printed map with nearby restaurants clearly labeled to the bag of pastries on the house for the kids, I just can't say enough about the kindness of the employees. What put it just over the top was the fact that I wasn't charged for my second night because I checked out around 2 pm. I got the rooms for the second night just to make sure we didn't have to rush out the next day (which I have done at several hotels before while on "staycations"). I have NEVER had a hotel tell me that I didn't have to pay for the second night, no matter WHAT time I actually ended up checking out! One of the wonderful employees told me he hoped it made up for the water slide being broken. Are you KIDDING me? It would have made up for much more than that if there were anything to complain about! In conclusion, this is a nice hotel that becomes a WONDERFUL hotel because each and every employee goes above and beyond. I whole-heartedly recommend it to anyone staying in the Phoenix area, and we WILL be back!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience!”
Reviews.Author: sahuaritaMom
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by a very friendly front desk staff. We paid a little extra and got a floor on the club level, very worth the extra money. Clean, comfortable room and bedding. Club level has free Wi FI, so it really paid for itself in the money I saved with the internet fees if we were on a regular floor. Very nice reception hour in the club level lounge, hostess very helpful. Spent a lot of time by the pool and the kids loved the waterslide. Continental breakfast was also great in the lounge area. Complimentary soda, bottle water. Even the toiletries were above the norm with little Q tips and cotton balls. We had room service, very yummy!

Reviews.Title: “An OK place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LondonGipsy
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in August and whilst it was ok I wouldn't stay again. The staff were friendly - especially in the lounge but they also seemed a little 'thin on the ground'. The telephone system didn't seem to work.The rooms were comfortable. My main reason for not staying again would be location as there didn't seem much around.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room and they even welcomed our dog!”
Reviews.Author: MaryEllenTravels
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times while traveling in the west. This time we had our dog with us and called ahead to see if we could bring him and they said yes. We had a wonderful, big room, very quiet and we loved it. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for travel”
Reviews.Author: bchood
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on our cross-country trip. It's a huge hotel - the decor is stuck in the 80's, but the rooms were clean. The staff was very friendly, and I ordered an omelet for breakfast that was so good! We had our dog with us and there was a lot of space to walk him around. The hotel is right off the interstate, which made is easy for passing through town.

Reviews.Title: “I will return”
Reviews.Author: lbar282
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews regarding the hotels appearance I was a little worried but upon my arrival I found out the information people had provided was incorrect. The Sheraton Crescent is a GREAT hotel to stay at whether its business or leisure. The rooms are large and clean the restrooms are fabulous and the employees are wonderful. I will definitely recommend this hotel, I will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “The hardest working staff I have ever witnessed!!!”
Reviews.Author: drehus
Reviews.Content: I am a well traveled person. I have timeshare with Marriott. I have never in any of my travels stayed with such a consistent hard working staff. Everyone from each waiter to the concierge, kind, courteous, and caring are words that describe this staff. This was a business/pleasure and I assure you that your staff made this more pleasure than business. Thank you for providing such excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT service!”
Reviews.Author: tshissler
Reviews.Content: I only stayed at the hotel for one night. It was very nice. I will for sure stay there again in the future. The staff practically tripped over themselves to care for their guests. It was a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Miss Phyllis and Mr Dunlap made our trip!”
Reviews.Author: baryj
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the treatment my 7 yr old son (Jacob) and I received from the entire staff at this facility. Absolutely first class! Phyllis and Dunlap topped the chart and left an indelible impression on my son. They combined to make us feel so at home and go above and beyond to cater to our most minor needs. Thanks so much and a big GOOD JOB to the smart people who chose to employee these folks. We WILL be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: lew1620
Reviews.Content: I was recently at the Sheraton Crescent in Phoenix for a work event. We were in the hotel for three days and loved every minute. The staff were friendly and the accommodations were comfortable. There is one waitress there that deserves and extra shout out. Consuela was there during our first breakfast. I am a vegetarian and knew my company had made arrangements for the vegetarians, I just didn't now what they were. I approached Consuela and asked. She quickly went to the back and brought my vegetarian breakfast out. That she brought me my breakfast with a smile wasn't that impressive, what was so impressive is that she remembered me every meal from that point on. She was our server for breakfast and lunch every day (and some days dinner also) and as soon as she saw me should would run to the back and get my food. In a group of 250 dog trainers, for her to remember me and serve me with a smile every day was wonderful. Every hotel should have an employee like Consuela.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: PapaBrownbear
Reviews.Content: Sister and her kids were in from Utah for a few days and we all stayed at the Crescent. The property was clean, staff was fantastic and kids had a ball. Slide at the pool was a huge hit for the kiddos and the clubhouse bar was camp for the adults. Phyliss and Dunlap were a great team upstairs, would say that we were true friends by departure day. Duane, at the pool was terrific with the kids, they can be a little tough to take, thanks Duane. With Castle and Coasters accross the street(AZ's only amuzement park) and great restaurants all around the hotel the stay was nothing short of perfect. Thank you Paige(General Manager) for your staff and property!

Reviews.Title: “Teen Birthday Party was a raving success at the Sheraton Crescent”
Reviews.Author: AnnVacation
Reviews.Content: We have lived in Phoenix for 16 years and when my teenager wanted to take friends to castles and coasters (right across the street), I searched for a hotel to take the group to....The Sheraton Crescent has a wonderul property!!! We were met by a very kind and professional man that helped us with bags (named Dunlap.... you rock!!! he also was very helpful later in our stay as well - made us feel like family) I set the kids up with a poolside tab... they played water games in the pool, enjoyed the waterslide (huge for a hotel)... the even played some sand volleyball (could have played tennis too!)... and had afew snacks by the pool... they changed and went to the concierge lounge for appetizers (very unusual for a hotel to have this open on weekends (another pat on the back for this hotel).. the lounge staff was WONDERFUL...bringing in a group of teens (no matter how well behaved) can surely result in some looks of disapproval but no... everyone welcomed them and was kind, friendly, and over the top professional!!! Off to castles and coasters amusement part for the evening..back to cut the cake at 12 midnight... the cake was ordered and delivered to the hotel by a bakery they recommended.. again... a great hit...YUMMY "over the top" fondant cake with volleyball... ... Our stay and party at this hotel was pulled off without a glitch... the staff is super nice and friendly and available when you need everyone.... I had a lovely conversation with the evening concierge lounge lady.... A SUPER GREAT HOTEL... accommodations were great.. rooms were clean and nice.. poolside is partially shaded and very private (nice in the sumer)... pool cabana staff was very funny and professional, and again friendly!! WAY TO GO!!! PS the history of this hotel is very interesting as well.. - Best Regards and my compliments to the staff and management of this hotel Ann Z. - Phoenix, Arizona

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding employees service and great facilities”
Reviews.Author: aebpwb7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were guests of the Sheraton Crescent Hotel in Phoenix on June 11, 2011. Our room was clean and comforable with a great view. The Hotel employees were courteous, efficient and competent. The restaurant provided quality food with an excellent atmosphere. The pool area was sheltered by trees and created a private, comfortable recreation area. Your employee, Dwayne Simon, is an asset to the Sheraton Hotels. I believe he saved my life. When I was using the water slide, lying down, I was holding my breath and after twisting and turning and exiting the slide into the pool, I was disorientated and could not breathe. In a matter of seconds, Dwayne jumped into the pool ( with all his street clothes on) and rescued me by firmly and gently lifting me ( I felt that his were the hands of God) out of the water and pool. Please recognize Dwayne for his quick thinking and action for me because I feel that I owe the rest of my life to him. Paul W. Breza

Reviews.Title: “Ok experience-”
Reviews.Author: limermaid
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an isolated location although there is a complimentary shuttle for local restaurants. There is nothing within walking distance to see or do- a cab is necessary to see the local attractions including a half hour ride to Scottsdale. The hotel itself is clean- nice pool area although the waterslide was closed. the restaurant was just OK. Recommend taking the metro to the Heard museum- the largest Native American Museum in the country.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for taking care of me, Dunlap”
Reviews.Author: gahbah
Reviews.Content: I was there to attend a Celebration of Life of Maxine Carpenter. My companion (also a senior citizen) and I found our way after asking directions of two or three different employees. We found a parking space on the 4th floor of the parking garage and managed to find the room where friends were gathered.. We went into the building through a door that had two steps without a railing, but that worked when a helpful guest assisted me as I was on crutches. Afterward we encountered an employee named Dunlap who offered to find a wheel chair for me. I gratefully accepted and was wheeled right to my car. He was very gracious and refused a tip. Carol Douglas

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Junie13
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Sheraton Crescent Hotel one night while on a road trip from Santa Fe, NM. This hotel could be easily seen as we were nearing the exit on the freeway. Parking in the garage was free. Check-in was pleasant and efficient. We elected to stay in one of the rooms on the club level. Free wi-fi came with the club level room. We went the the evening hors d'oeuvres which was a buffet of tasty offerings, all complementary. Wanting something light for dinner, this was all that we needed before turning in. The hostess was delightful. We only needed to pay for our wine. In the morning the complementary breakfast buffet was more than ample. The food and coffee were delicious. Our room was clean, quiet, and comfortable. Check out was efficient. We would definitely come back and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel covers all the bases when it comes to customer service.”
Reviews.Author: 35805Nancy
Reviews.Content: Outstanding customer service on a consistent basis. Staff is attentive, caring and always anticipates your needs. Hotel is well maintained, beds are the best and room service and restaurant food is always delicious and well prepared.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Great Value - Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: hope4one
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its central location in Phoenix and the variety of sports facilities at the hotel pools, tennis courts, basketball. Staff is very professional and we received excellent service during our stay. The hotel facilities and grounds are well maintained and the covered parking is a plus. Our rooms were clean, large and comfortable. The hotel was quiet and had easy access to the interstate for a short drive to all major Phoenix attractions, dining and shopping. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Large, Clean Rooms - Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: faythe70
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel when in Phoenix for the NASCAR race and to watch some spring training baseball. We were very pleased with the hotel and the amenities. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was large and the bed very comfortable. While the hotel is not within walking distance to many restaurants or shopping, we did not find that a distraction for us. There is shopping and dining alternatives within a short drive. I travel frequently for work and am pretty discriminating when it comes to hotels. We would definitely stay here again if in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “smooth and easy stay (twice!)”
Reviews.Author: biztrip-11
Reviews.Content: Spent a nice 2 nights, QUIET room, great breakfast. Emily at the front desk was a peach! Got sent back to Phoenix the next week, knew right away where I would be staying ! Thanks George S. for the hospitality & helping with the room change, and thanks and kudos to both of them for remembering me!

Reviews.Title: “great rooms with wonderful service and food”
Reviews.Author: tanner17
Reviews.Content: I have stayed several times at this Sheraton and it is a great place. The front desk is friendly and very helpful. The resturant is fantastic with very good service and wonderful food. The building is old but up to or above Sheraton standards. Ask for a room overlooking the garden level and you will be very happy. Parking is in the garage attached to but not a part of the hotel and is free. It is well located for any thing you need to do in the Phoenix area.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with great amenities but club level is not so exclusive due to lack of checks”
Reviews.Author: Nicky6209
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location, is set in stunning grounds, has great amenities and helpful staff. We paid extra for club level and therefore had the use of the lounge which served delicious food at breakfast and evening. However, the lounge is left open even though it has a key only access facility. The staff did not check which guests had club entitlement outside the lounge even though one morning they had a list. They just said you are here so you must be OK. This situation resulted in others coming in who should not have been there, sometimes families with children eager to get a free meal. Pressure was put on the lounge for seating and it lost its more exclusive atmosphere. The problem could be so easily be rectified so I trust the manager will take note.

Reviews.Title: “The Sheraton Crescent is a Phoenix Rising...”
Reviews.Author: valerieanne101
Reviews.Content: Matt, as Front Desk Supervisor, was efficient, friendly, and professional. Steve Szabo, in the bar, handled what could have been an awkward scene with a large crowd, with grace, kept his cool, kept others cool. Phyllis, in the Club Lounge, kept the food and drinks coming, yet was unobstrusive. Paige went above and beyond to anticipate our needs, ones we didn't even know about, and made us feel very welcome. Thank you to all.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: katrine_ca
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I love staying at Sheraton hotels - I truly always feel at home wherever I am. The staff are always so courteous and helpful and the rooms always well appointed and clean. Stayed here for 5 days with extended family, using it as a base for day trips. Didn't eat in any of the restaurants, however, as we were on the road from morning until early evening. Had room service once, which arrived as ordered and hot -- very tasty too! There's a Denny's across the road which we ate at once, but I think that's it for restaurants you can walk to (don't quote me on that though!). The only negative thing I have to say is that the slide is located in a fenced-off area from the main pool. We were there at the end of March, so there weren't too many children around. We did manage to get in once, as a young boy had gone to the front desk to get an attendant to open it for us. Unfortunately she made it clear that we were an inconvenience to her - presumably she had something better to do than sit there and veg in the glorious sun. We would have liked to sit there a while and dry off after going down the slide, but apparently you have to just go down and get out. My husband came down later and wanted to have a go at the slide, but of course, would not embarass himself by having to walk to the front desk to get the attendant to open it for a grown man! can't blame him! Anyway, that was definately not what I expect from a Sheraton ... being made to feel an inconvenience and an annoyance to the staff. Otherwise, I would definately recommend this hotel. The front desk staff are amazing, so helpful, in fact all the staff (except slide pool attendant) were so friendly and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “7-STAR HOTEL...Best Staff & Food Ever!!! Makes You Feel Like Family!!!”
Reviews.Author: cemcflc
Reviews.Content: This is a 7-STAR HOTEL in my book!!! I'm a seasoned traveler with a software company, so I spend 75% of my time in hotels. I stayed at the Sheraton Crescent Hotel from January to March of this year. Everyone on the hotel's staff...from the front desk (TRAVIS, MATTHEW & EMILY) to the bellmen (GEORGE, DANNY & ROBERT) to my favorite bartender ever (STEVE) to room service (MARCELLINO & RAQUEL) to the incredible chef (GARY)...each and every one of them became like family to me. Not only was the service outstanding, but the food was amazing and the grounds were spectacular!!! This was definitely my home away from home. One day, I become ill with a bad cold and the hotel staff surprised me by delivering a large tray of hot tea, honey, assorted packs of cough drops and a 'Get Well' card (signed by the staff) to my room. Now, that's special! In terms of the restaurant, I highly recommend the sea bass with mango salsa chutney and the crab cakes and the barbeque chicken pizza and…. Well, as you can see, everything on their menu is incredible!!! Don’t forget dessert!!! The chocolate molten cake and the apple tart are to die for!!! I gained 8 lbs while staying at this hotel, but it was worth it. Luckily, they have a fantastic playground for both adults & children… 2 tennis courts, several indoor racquetball courts, a fitness center, sauna, basketball courts, heated swimming pool, whirlpool and waterslide. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable and every room has a balcony. The hotel also offers a FREE daily shuttle service, which was a huge bonus! I look forward to returning to my Crescent Family, again, one day!!! YOU’RE AMAZING!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay for family”
Reviews.Author: mgdog
Reviews.Content: My son is 8 and my daughter is 11. My son loved the slide (my daughter did too, but that's not her thing). The pool area is beautiful and the water temp is perfect. The slide is separate from the pool area, so you cannot monitor the slide area and swim at the same time. Not a big deal. We paid extra for the 'club level.' That was well worth it. The morning breakfast was good and the evening 'snacks' were excellent. In addition, you stay on the top levels so the views are great. We enjoyed our stay so much, I tried to extend it a bit, but couldn't arrange the flight. We will go back. The service was the best of any hotel I've been. They go out of their way to accommodate you. The 'flavored' water was a nice touch. Note to management: Whoever was working breakfast on March 31 and April 1 needs a bit more training. She did not turn on the cup-warmer and the coffee was luke warm. Apparently she did not clean up after her shift either. The wonderful gal on Thursday evening was delayed in set-up because she was trying to clean up from breakfast. There is a small, family-owned Mexican restaurant across (west) of the Metro Center (which is across Hwy 17 from the Sheraton). Highly recommend for good, reasonably priced food. There is a Blimpie right across the street from the hotel too. Be sure to print out a BOGO coupon before you go. (just do a search)

Reviews.Title: “Nice place overall!!!”
Reviews.Author: bigmac12
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights while we were in town for spring training. Everything was great for the most part. The pool was great (felt almost like a resort), the lobby and the rooms were both very spacious. The only thing that needed some work was the service. The hotel restaurant was incredibly slow. We were seated promptly but waited over 30 minutes just to be recognized. I even waived my arm to try and get a waiters attention (he had to have been only 5 feet away) and still no acknowledgment. Finally the manager came over and took our order and got us drinks. During this whole time, the waiter never once said anything to us and we ended up being there over an hour just to eat breakfast. We were late to our activity for the day. The next day, we didn't want to risk it so we ordered breakfast to go. It still took 45 minutes! It wasn't busy either morning so I'm not sure what the problem was, but we had a tour scheduled for this morning and barely made it in time because breakfast held us up! Nice hotel, but avoid the restaurant if you have to be anywhere to be later.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Crescent exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: jandjmcc23
Reviews.Content: First of all, I always research hotel reviews on Trip Advisor before booking. Thanks to other reviews, we upgraded to the Club Level at the Sheraton Crescent. The food was great in the Club Lounge for both breakfast and "happy hour", (which was more like a light dinner). WiFi is free on the Club Level and there is an endless supply of bottled water, as well. The customer service at this hotel is excellent. We arrived early and were given a room on a separate floor and then were allowed to move up to the Club Level once our room was ready. We were also graciously granted a late check-out on our departure date. Every single employee we encountered at this hotel rom the Club Lounge attendants, front desk personnel, cleaning staff, pool attendants and the restaurant staff were gracious and attentive. Sheraton should take note of whatever customer service training is being provided to this group and share it with other properties. The pool is nice with plenty of comfortable chaise lounges. Our boys really enjoyed the water slide. Parking at this hotel is very convenient and free. The location of the hotel in relation to the spring training baseball facilities is perfect, central. Other reviews complained about the highway noise, but it wasn't a factor for us-- basically a constant hum, like white noise. We would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again if we return.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: Fernnie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good to its loyal Gold Members. The Executive Lounge is well stocked with food for breakfast and in the evening appetizers with a host tending to the bar area. The accommodations were very clean and crisp and when we asked for a late check out there was no issue about it at all. We will definitely come back to this hotel next time we are in the area. It is always gratifying when the staff recognizes its loyal members and make every effort to be accommodating. This isn't true of all hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Quite remote location”
Reviews.Author: ExperiencedPL
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel just to earn points as a Starwood member. On a map it looks like it's quite close to the city center, but in fact you have to take a taxi to get there. Taxis in Phoenix are very expensive. Paid $45 to get to the hotel from the airport. The Botanical Garden is $55 away. I was very disappointed with the "mountains view" as they are far away from the building - different from what you can see on their website. Besides, the balconies are nasty - all in birds' droppings. The weather happened to be cold, so I didn't use the pools, but I noticed that the water slide was not working, even though at the beginning of my stay it was warmer and some people were sunbathing. I hated that breakfast in Club Lounge was only until 9 am. Definitely too early for me. Choice of food in the evenings very poor.

Reviews.Title: “3rd Thursdays Ear Candy Charity Event Featuring The Waters”
Reviews.Author: dulcimer01
Reviews.Content: This monthly event is terrific and supports a wonderful cause championed by Ear Candy Charity which strives to provide children access to music education. It's held on the third Thursday of each month in the beautiful courtyard of the Sheraton Crescent Hotel. A terrific and exceptionally talented band, The Waters, performs music from their own catalog and beautifully rendered versions of some of the best music you hear today. I've made it a point to never miss this event. Not only is it a thoroughly entertaining way to spend an evening but I get to feel good knowing that it helps out a great cause.

Reviews.Title: “They were the WHOLE package”
Reviews.Author: fargobanker
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference with a group of coworkers. Our employer determined where we were staying but I couldn't have asked for any better service, food, room, atmosphere. It was clean, they greeted us on an unusually cool day with hot chocolate and smiles. Approached you to offer assistance when they felt is was needed. Most of our meals were buffet style with just a few choices but a colleague of mine who did not care for the peppers was made a special entree and served with a smile. Everyone including managment was working to make sure our stay was enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “BEST SERVICE EVER..THEY TREAT US LIKE FAMILY”
Reviews.Author: tvlgrma
Reviews.Content: This is actually a long time coming...to start with we have been staying at the Sheraton for many years now in the summer...2 yrs ago we had my grandaughter's birthday there, inviiting her little friends from chruch and school..her first party was when she was "5" it was the best kind of Birthday ever, it was August..we ordered Pizza and Lemonade for everyone and was so good..I can't even tell you how great we were treated and they even put "Happy 5th Birthday Marissa" on the Marquis...so, then last year we asked Marissa what she wanted to do for her birthday and she wanted it at the Sheraton again..The attention from everyone, the dest, the manager, the pool people, they all remembered her from before..they even gave her a present like the theme of her party..I can't say enough about the Sheraton crescent..it is our summer home..the rooms are so comfortable and nice, and again the staff (all of them are exceptional) Marissa says she wants to have her birthday there for the rest of her entire life..thank yu everyone for all your attention and not just to us, they treat everyone so well..You make our Summer..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer experience”
Reviews.Author: RodeWearier
Reviews.Content: No stranger to business travel, I begrudgingly accepted a suggestion to stay across the street from my business meeting location. I left my familiar Hilton/Mariott comfort zone and usual thorough research and mapquesting and went for convenience. The property was very attractive, service personnel seemed truly sincere in their attentiveness. Club level "refreshments and continental breakfast" were the most satisfying I've ever experienced. Sales Manager,Ttammi Truax was visible on property at numerous times and made a point to seek out this unfamiliar face and introduce herself. Through some quirk of fate, I was given a HUGE parlor/suite with an enormous balcony. I'd recommend it as an assembly space for exec. business sessions or family get togethers. I'll go back Just so Tammi gets the sales credit!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful for events!”
Reviews.Author: EJinPhx
Reviews.Content: My company recently held our 2011 Kick-Off at the Sheraton Crescent. The hotel staff made sure everything I wanted was done perfectly! Not only is the staff uber-efficient, but so friendly and easy-to-work with. They helped me look really good! Comments I heard from employees: Location is convenient from all areas of the Valley, great food, good atmosphere, close and ample parking, and an overall nice place. Plus, I was able to do all this and stay within my budget guidelines! I would recommend it to anyone planning a business event. EJ, Phoenix AZ

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: croozn33
